On DATE the applicant was arrested by officers from the anti - terrorist branch of ORG on suspicion of membership of the ORG ( ORG ) , an illegal organisation ; he was arrested in a restaurant along with a woman , PERSON According to the arrest report signed by CARDINAL police officers , the applicant and PERSON attempted to escape , following which the officers were obliged to use force in order to effect their arrest . Thereupon , the applicant and PERSON were found to possess false identity cards .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was medically examined by a doctor who noted that he was suffering from pain and restricted movement in his shoulders .

CARDINAL . The applicant was subsequently placed in ORG . He was allegedly ill - treated there . In particular , he claimed to have been subjected to hanging , to have had his testicles squeezed and to have been forced to lie in ice covered by a wet blanket .

“ An ecchymosis of yellow - green colour of QUANTITY under the left eye ; a haematoma of QUANTITY on the exterior of the right eyebrow ; a scabbed wound of QUANTITY on the vertex ; scabbed grazes on the exterior of the left wrist ; an ecchymosis of yellow colour of QUANTITY and a hyperaemia of QUANTITY in the right armpit ; sensitivity in the right testicle ... ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken before the public prosecutor and a single judge at ORG . On both occasions the applicant maintained that he had been subjected to torture while in police custody . He submitted that he had been subjected to hanging , that his testicles had been squeezed and that he had been forced to lie in ice covered by a wet blanket .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judge at ORG ordered the applicant 's pre - trial detention . The applicant was subsequently placed in PERSON prison .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a criminal complaint with ORG against the police officers who had allegedly inflicted the ill - treatment on him . He stated that he had been beaten , hung by the arms , immersed in cold water and forced to lie in ice . Furthermore , his testicles had been squeezed . Stating that he would recognise the police officers who had been responsible for his ill - treatment , the applicant requested that an investigation be initiated into his allegations .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the ORG issued a decision not to prosecute anyone in relation to the applicant 's allegations . He noted in the decision that the applicant had refused to go to the public prosecutor 's office from prison to make statements and that the police officers had denied the veracity of the allegations against them .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the decision of DATE was quashed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG filed a bill of indictment with ORG against QUANTITY police officers from the anti - terrorist branch of ORG , charging them with ill - treatment under LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG issued a decision based on lack of jurisdiction and transferred the case to ORG because the charges of torture should have been brought under LAW of the former LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant joined the case against the police officers as a civil party .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , ORG postponed the hearings as some of the accused police officers could not be summoned .
CARDINAL . On various dates the accused police officers and the applicant made statements before different courts at the request of ORG . These statements were then sent to that court .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held that the criminal proceedings against the police officers should be discontinued on the ground that the prosecution was time - barred ( zamanaşımı ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor at ORG filed a bill of indictment against the applicant and CARDINAL other persons . The applicant was charged with attempting to undermine the constitutional order , an offence proscribed by LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held the first hearing on the merits .
CARDINAL . Pursuant to Law no . CARDINAL of DATE abolishing ORG , published in ORG on DATE , the case against the applicant was transferred to ORG .

CARDINAL . According to the information in the case file , the applicant was released from pre - trial detention on DATE . However , the case against the applicant is still pending before the Thirteenth Chamber of ORG .
